segments.text: So, listen, Tony, if the phone rings, take it in the back, and then come out and tell me who it is. Just say Joe's being with a camera crew. Just for about ten minutes. We'll do about five minutes, ten minutes, right, Ira? That's right.

segments.text: Well, you know when...
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: Great thing about starting a new show is utter anonymity. Nobody really knows what to expect from you.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: This interviewee did not know us from Adam.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: Okay, well, what? About a minute. We're one minute five into the new show right now. It is stretching in front of us. The perfect future.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: yet to be fulfilled an uncharted little world a little baby coming into the world no little scars in order anything
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: Nobody hearing my words right now is thinking, oh, man.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: Remember that show? Back when it used to be good? Well, sure, I never missed that show. Back in the old days, back in the first couple years, before it got so-called popular.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: Back when it was still good...
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: Actually, I think that force, that human desire...
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: to say that.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02

segments.text: is so strong to say that I was there back when that show was good. That force is so strong. It is so basic to who we are as people.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_02
